data.enText: to show sth in a public place for people to enjoy or to give them information

data.chText: 他们将在商品交易会上展出他们新的设计。
data.enText: They will be exhibiting their new designs at the trade fairs.

data.chText: 他经常在当地的画廊举办画展。
data.enText: He exhibits regularly in local art galleries.

data.chText: 表现，显示，显出（感情、品质或能力）
data.enText: to show clearly that you have or feel a particular feeling, quality or ability

data.chText: 病人表现出疲劳和记忆力丧失的迹象。
data.enText: The patient exhibited signs of fatigue and memory loss.
an object or a work of art put in a public place, for example a museum, so that people can see it
a thing that is used in court to prove that sb is guilty or not guilty

data.chText: 当庭出示的第一件物证就是控方称为杀人凶器的一把刀。
data.enText: The first exhibit was a knife which the prosecution claimed was the murder weapon.

data.chText: 这批新展品明年将在美国十二个城市巡回展出。
data.enText: The new exhibit will tour a dozen US cities next year.

simple_means.memory_skill: ex 出 + hibit 有；拿 → 拿出 → 展览

means: 表现，显示，显出(感情、品质或能力)

example: the museum had many exhibits of oriental art

tr: an object or statement produced before a court of law and referred to while giving evidence

example: She parades her new husband around town

tr: to show, make visible or apparent
example: The Metropolitan Museum is exhibiting Goya's works this month
Why don't you show your nice legs and wear shorter skirts?
National leaders will have to display the highest skills of statesmanship

tr: give an exhibition of to an interested audience
example: We will demo the new software in Washington

tr: show an attribute, property, knowledge, or skill

value.def: If someone or something shows a particular quality, feeling, or type of behaviour, you can say that they exhibit it.

example.ex: He has exhibited symptoms of anxiety and overwhelming worry...
example.tran: 他表现出焦躁不安和过度忧虑的症状。

example.ex: Two cats or more in one house will also exhibit territorial behaviour...
example.tran: 一所房子里有两只以上的猫时也会出现划分地盘的行为。

example.ex: The economy continued to exhibit signs of decline in September.
example.tran: 9月份，经济继续呈现出衰退的迹象。

value.def: When a painting, sculpture, or object of interest is exhibited, it is put in a public place such as a museum or art gallery so that people can come to look at it. You can also say that animals are exhibited in a zoo.

example.ex: His work was exhibited in the best galleries in America, Europe and Asia.
example.tran: 他的作品在美洲、欧洲和亚洲最好的美术馆展出。

example.ex: ...a massive elephant exhibited by London Zoo in the late 19th Century.
example.tran: 19世纪末伦敦动物园展出的一头巨型大象

example.ex: Five large pieces of the wall are currently on exhibition in London.
example.tran: 那堵墙的5块大碎片眼下正在伦敦展出。

value.def: When artists exhibit, they show their work in public.

example.ex: By 1936 she was exhibiting at the Royal Academy.
example.tran: 到1936年她已在皇家艺术学院展出作品。

value.def: An exhibit is a painting, sculpture, or object of interest that is displayed to the public in a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: Shona showed me round the exhibits.

value.def: An exhibit is a public display of paintings, sculpture, or objects of interest, for example in a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: ...an exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
example.tran: 大都会艺术博物馆的展览

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 exhibition

value.def: An exhibit is an object that a lawyer shows in court as evidence in a legal case.
If you say that someone exhibits something, you mean that they are showing it openly or publicly in order to be admired, noticed, or believed.

example.ex: Other women seemed content and even exhibited their bellies with pride...
example.tran: 其他女人似乎很满足，甚至还骄傲地炫耀她们的肚腩。

example.ex: He seems to want to exhibit his shame.
example.tran: 他似乎想要让大家知道自己感到羞愧。

partsOfSpeech.dec: ex 出 + hibit 有；拿 → 拿出 → 展览

partsOfSpeech.d: 习惯（长期固有的 → 习惯）

partsOfSpeech.dec: habit 有；拿 + ual 有…性质的 → 惯常的
habit 有；拿 + uate 使 → 使习惯于
in 不 + hibit 有；拿 → 不让拿 → 禁止
inhibit 禁止，阻止 + or 表器物 → 抑制剂
pro 向前 + hibit 有；拿 → 在前面拿住 → 不让前进 → 阻止
pro 向前 + hibit 有；拿 + ive …的 → 禁止的；价格极贵的
co 共同 + habit 居住 → 同居
habit 居住 + able 可…的 → 可居住的
habit 居住 + ant 人 → 居住者
habit 居住 + at 地方 → （动植物）居住地
in 使… + habit 居住 → 居住
inhabit 居住 + ant 表人 → 住户，居民
un 无 + inhabit 居住 + ed 表形容词 → 无人居住的 → 杳无人迹的
